title: Best bargain anti-ageing beauty products for 2019

Don’t spend a single penny on beauty products until you read this!

The Real Beauty Awards are the only magazine awards where anti-ageing products are sent out to hundreds of real women who try them over four weeks, then report back on the results.

Why take the opinion of one or two industry insiders when you can trust the REAL experts: women who have actually tried the products?

How it works

More than 150 products from 70 big beauty brands are selected, then each product gets sent out to five tester (that's 700 real women between the ages of 35-75 in total!).

Where possible, the products are blind tested then the feedback is sent back.

The winners below are the products that worked best for the majority of the testers - it's as simple as that.

So, here are the best products under £40 that came out top with our testers...

Day creams *blind tested*

An absolute stand-out in the under £35 price bracket.

Every single tester rated it ‘very good’ for reducing wrinkles, and all but one had results so good that they were showered with compliments about their skin.

Our tester said: 'This melted into my skin.

'A small amount went a long way to keep my face thoroughly moisturised all day.

'After four weeks, my face felt smooth and soft; fine lines were less visible.

'My face felt fresher and rejuvenated and people said I looked refreshed, like I’d just came back from a spa or being on holiday.’

Anti-wrinkle results all round and very happy testers, who loved how it made their skin feel straight away.

And there were plenty more benefits by the end of the four-week trial.

Our tester said: Left skin amazingly smooth and soft.

'I found it plumped my skin, reduced sagging and my lines appeared reduced.

'A friend asked if I’d been for a facial or changed my foundation.

'I don’t wear foundation, so this is clearly a winner if it helps you look younger.’

This affordable Superdrug brand is targeted at mature skin, so while one person found the texture a little heavy, all our testers rated it as ‘very good’ or ‘good’ for reducing lines and wrinkles, and most got compliments.

Our tester said: ‘I’ve always been bothered about the lines around my eyes, and I noticed that my laughter lines became visibly reduced.

'My skin looked more radiant, and my husband mentioned my eyes looked younger.

'I love this cream, it’s great.’

Night creams *blind tested*

No sleepless nights for us when it came to finding our winner.

Every tester saw both instant and long-term benefits, and would continue taking this rose-scented cream to bed with them.

They all agreed it was a pleasure to use.

Our tester said: '‘From the first morning I used this my skin was smoother and more glowing.

'After the first week there was a noticeable improvement – the lines around my eyes were much smoother and my skin looked much better.

'Some of my friends have commented on how well I’m looking at the minute.

'I actually forgot I was testing a night cream and was wondering what was making my skin look so good!’

This scored especially highly for immediate benefits, with testers enjoying brighter, glowier, smoother skin straight away.

After four weeks, all but one tester had seen results good enough to want to keep on using it.

Our tester said: ‘My skin instantly had a fresher texture and more even look in the morning.

'My complexion was brighter – if this wasn’t a night-time product I could have gone without make-up immediately after use.

'After four weeks, lines and wrinkles were less visible. People said I looked well.’

The majority enjoyed the way this cream melted in and left them hydrated and more radiant.

Our tester said: ‘My skin was quite parched when I started using this and I was very pleased to see it looked a lot better following my first use.

'After four weeks, it does appear to have made my skin look smoother.

'My skin looks brighter, more radiant.

'This is quite a rich cream and seems very good at repairing tired skin- not quite a face lift in a jar, but getting there.’

Eye creams *blind tested*

Our top-rated high street eye creams didn’t impress as universally as the premium products, but after four weeks’ use, our winner was rated ‘good’ or ‘very good’ at wrinkle fighting by all but one of our testers

Our testers said: ‘Very good – lines/wrinkles were much less visible and I could instantly see a difference.

'I used it in between my eyes as well, for my frown line, and it was noticeably reduced in appearance afterwards.’

One of the most affordable eye creams we tested, this won loyal support from everyone who tested it.

Although it didn’t perform as well on fine lines and wrinkles as our winner, it did have some effect on them and extra benefits to boot.

Our tester said: ‘It works well as an anti-ageing eye cream, with an added bonus of helping with puffy eyes.

'The first day I woke up with puffy eyes, but about 30 minutes after I applied this the puffiness was almost non-existent.

'This is never the case: if I wake up puffy-eyed, that’s how I go back to bed.

'After week two, fine lines and wrinkles around my eyes had reduced a lot.’

Just squeezing into our mass market price bracket, this cream also did well in the anti-ageing stakes, with more than half of testers rating it ‘very good’ on wrinkles.

Our tester said: ‘Even during the first week I started noticing a difference.

'Lines were less visible and my eyelids seemed tighter with a less hooded look.

'My friend commented that I looked fresher.

'I’ve tried so many different products and never really had great results.

'With this, though, for the first time I can actually see a difference.’

Serums

All testers saw at least some anti-ageing effect from this and were sufficiently impressed to want to add it to their regular routine.

They all declared it ‘amazing’ to use – even those with sensitive skin – and most saw firming, plumping, radiance-boosting results.

Our testers said: 'The fine lines at the side of my eyes are not as noticeable and the texture of my skin is smoother.

'The biggest benefit was a firm lifting effect.

'Someone said, “You are looking well, have you been away?”

'I’d just done a 42-hour week of shifts as a nurse.’

The distinctive scent was divisive, but our testers persevered nonetheless and found the results worth it – softer, hydrated skin and a decent line-smoothing effect.

Our tester said: ‘I’ve never been a firm believer in the necessity for a serum, but this changed my mind.

'Overall my skin looks healthier and better nourished.

'The lines around my eyes and on my forehead seem softer and less defined.

'A noticeable boost and a cost that wouldn’t do too much damage to my budget.’

Although not all testers reported anti-ageing effects, most saw a definite difference and reported firmer skin at the end of four weeks.

Our tester said: ‘I’m sure the lines at the side of my eyes are fainter, and my skin felt softer and more refreshed.

'The silver balls made the difference, as it felt more soothing than using my fingers.

'My husband said it made me look fresh and not tired-looking.’
description: From anti-ageing creams to smoothing serums, these beauty products from the likes of Vichy, Superdrug B. and No7, scored top in the Real Beauty Awards
